results.title: How much is enough
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: Deals with the work of the United Nations Children’s Fund in Africa, the Near East, Pakistan, the Orient and the West Indies. It shows the scope and the type of work done by the organisation which raises money all over the world to help needy children in underdeveloped areas

results.title: How much does the earth weigh?: measurement and mass
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how to calculate the size and composition of the earth, explaining the difference between weight and mass using a spring scale and a balance scale. Also covers the scientific ideas of displacement, volume and density.

results.title: How much cooperation?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
A discussion-provoking film about employer and employee office cooperation. A supervisor returns from an out of town trip with a rush job. He speaks to the staff about it and promises to have it ready so they won’t have to work back on it.

results.title: How much affection?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
A social guidance docu-drama promoting restraint against premarital sex. After nearly succumbing to her boyfriend’s advances, teenager Laurie seeks her mother’s advice. Following a sensible discussion with her mother and the lesson provided by her friend Eileen, a victim of her physical urges, Laurie considers the long term consequences of sexual temptation.

results.title: How many members in a set
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Children are presented with a variety of materials through which to learn mathematical concepts. The teacher invites several children to group small toy cars into various sets and endeavours to lead them to the abstract notion of members of a set. From here the film then moves around the class and observes the activities of other children with the material offered them.

results.title: How many colours? = Cuantos colores?
results.creator_credit: Patrik Axen, AFTRS and Adam Sebire
results.brief_description: This short film asks us to consider the colours of Cuba: the variety of colours of the tobacco in their cigars; the multicultural array of colours of its people; the colours of socialism and the colours of the capitalists who are making it a tourist haven. Filmed largely in one of Havana’s biggest cigar producing factories, this film is also a celebration of a revolutionary culture where workers and working life has not become exclusively mechanised and rationalised. A vibrant celebration of Cuba, workers, unionism and the much maligned tobacco leaf.
